bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 70 (Thursday, April 22, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. GREEN of Tennessee:H.J. Res. 43.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article V[Page H2109]

item.name: Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties Subcommittee

item.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to require that the Supreme Court of the United States be composed of nine justices.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties.

item.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to require that the Supreme Court be composed of not more than nine justices.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties.

item.title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to require that the Supreme Court of the United States be composed of not more than 9 justices.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

item.title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to require that the Supreme Court of the United States be composed of nine justices.

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 8.

item.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to require that the Supreme Court of the United States be composed of nine justices.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties.

item.name: Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

summary.text: This joint resolution proposes an amendment to the Constitution requiring the Supreme Court to be composed of nine Justices. If the size of the Supreme Court is increased to more than nine Justices before ratification of this amendment, those additional offices are void.

bill.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to require that the Supreme Court of the United States be composed of nine justices.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
